message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: class FacadeItemIterator implements Iterator<FacadeItem> {
    final Iterator<Item> delegate; // backing iterator
    
    FacadeItemIterator(Iterator<Item> delegate) {
        this.delegate = delegate;
    }
    
    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return delegate.hasNext();
    }
    
    @Override
    public FacadeItem next() {
        return new FacadeItem(delegate.next());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are extending the ForwardingIterator class from Guava, which expects the overridden next() method to return the same type as the delegate iterator (Item in this case). However, you want to return FacadeItem instead. To achieve this, you can create a custom iterator class that implements the Iterator<FacadeItem> interface and wraps the delegate iterator. In the next() method, you can create a new FacadeItem object using the delegate's next() method and return it.
